intro: Hieracium surrejanum, commonly known as the Southern European hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium surrejanum is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in dry environments.
